data.title: POWER-GEN Showcases Industry’s Latest and Greatest
data.meta_description: POWER-GEN International 2004, in Orlando, provided a forum for dozens of notable power industry announcements and product introductions.
data.text:
POWER-GEN International 2004, in Orlando, provided a forum for dozens of notable power industry announcements and product introductions. (More details from POWER-GEN can be found in the wrap-up article that begins on page 42.)

Siemens has entered the wind energy business with the acquisition of Danish wind turbine manufacturer Bonus Energy A/S. The Siemens Wind Power Division, headquartered in Brande, Denmark, plans to double current sales volume within the next five years pursuing land and offshore projects in a market growing at more than 10 percent annually. Also, Siemens announced adoption of an English-language-based naming strategy to provide consistency among Siemens Power Generation products and services that currently include historical nomenclature from Westinghouse, Demag Delaval, Alstom and other acquired companies.

GE Energy’s nuclear business has launched GE Energy’s Performance 20, a service to help evaluate and enhance the reliability, performance and safety of nuclear plants through analysis of major plant systems, equipment and components; identifying the need for repairs and replacement parts; and determining the potential for uprates. GE Energy also announced its selection as the wind turbine supplier for MidAmerican Energy Company’s 310.5 MW Iowa wind project, which will rank among the largest wind generation facilities in the world when completed later this year.

Wärtsilä North America announced a contract for what will be the largest reciprocating engine plant in the United States. The plant, which will provide power to the Barrick Goldstrike Mines located near Reno, Nev., will consist of 14 gas-fired Wärtsilä 20V34SG engines with a total net output of 115.6 MW.

For the fourth consecutive year, Alstom-supplied boilers earned top ranking among U.S. coal-fired units as the lowest emitters of NOx, according to 2003 data from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Alstom also announced a contract award from Public Service of New Hampshire for a 50 MW wood-fired fluidized bed boiler in Portsmouth, N.H.

Zinc-Flow battery technolgoy – Illustration courtesy of Premium Power Corp. Click here to enlarge image

Microturbine manufacturer Capstone Turbine announced the opening of a new direct sales and factory service center in Brooklyn, coinciding with a recent announcement by the New York Public Service Commission to open distributed generation interconnections to network grids, such as those going into operation in New York City.

Black & Veatch and Uhde GmbH announced an alliance to respond to growing demands for coal gasification in the United States. The alliance will facilitate commercial offerings for engineering, procurement and construction of gasification and integrated gasification combined cycle projects that have selected the Shell coal gasification technology for solid fuels such as coal and petroleum coke.

Premium Power Corp. announced its PowerBlock 150 high-density energy management system. The product is unique in its capacity to provide mass energy storage, power quality assurance and utility service management all within a single enclosure. The system’s Zinc-Flow battery technology uses a zinc bromide solution that is recyclable and disposable into public and private wastewater systems. Unlike lead-acid batteries, the zinc bromide system produces no hydrogen gas nor does it present severe hazards in the event of a spill or building fire.

Tampa Armature Works (TAW) and TVA Power Services have formed an alliance to perform a wide variety of maintenance, repair and overhaul services for power generation plants. Capabilities include repair and reconditioning of electric motors, high-voltage and high-speed turbines, core- and shell-form transformers, high-pressure pumps and valves, and switchgear.

Solar Turbines Inc. introduced the cold-end-drive, single-shaft 6 MW Taurus 65 industrial gas turbine generator set for cogeneration, combined cycle and other industrial power generation applications. Solar also announced the availability of the 14.9 MW Titan 130 Mobile Power Unit to address the demand for peaking power in a compact, highway transportable package.

Plug Power introduced three new product configurations designed specifically for electric utility substation backup. The 5 kW hydrogen-fueled GenCore fuel cell system, designed to provide extended run backup power, is now available with floating ground in 48 Vdc, 108 Vdc and 120 Vdc outputs to meet unique requirements of electric utility distribution and transmission substations.

Emerson is offering increased security and simulation enhancements to its Ovation power plant control system. The expanded security offerings enable customers to proactively address cyber security issues and help address pending security standards including NERC 1300 being established by the North American Electric Reliability Council. The addition of virtual controller technology to the Ovation Simulator Suite offers a hardware replica of a plant’s actual expert control system. Conversely, in the virtual control architecture, the actual controllers are replaced with Ovation virtual controllers that reside on a MicroSoft Windows-based personal computer.

ASCO Power Technologies introduced an advanced multiple engine power control system for emergency standby power – the 4000 Series. Switchgear can be customized to satisfy specific power system requirements by adding or configuring a variety of standard modules, allowing quick delivery and lead times compared with customer engineered systems. Any manufacturer’s circuit breakers can be specified with the new system to match existing equipment or user preference, and the system is compatible with any brand of engine-generator. It automatically adjusts the number of engines needed to match loads and provides load management controls to avoid overloading engines.

Photo courtesy of Plug Power Click here to enlarge image

Watlow showcased its new nonstandard thermocouple, WATCOUPLE, which is designed to provide more accurate measurement and exhibit three times less drift than Type K thermocouples.

Pratt & Whitney Power systems announced the sale of an FT8 MOBILEPAC unit to Union Electrica de Canarias Generacion in the Canary Islands. Union Electrica becomes the launch customer for the MOBILEPAC, which will provide 25 MW of quick-response, flexible peaking power.

Techinomics announced its intention to begin a power plant test program of its Rotating Throat technology, which re-engineers primary air flow through the pulverizer cyclone separator phase of the combustion cycle to remove noncombustible sulfur and mercury-laden material from the coal stream. Preliminary testing has indicated mercury levels up to 18 times higher than in the feed coal and sulfur levels up to three times higher than the feed.

OmniMetrix launched the G-6500-i wireless generator monitoring system, which enables equipment owners to monitor and control machinery from anywhere on earth, with a single point of connection through a web interface. The system is particularly suited to companies with prime power assets in remote locations.

“I Love NY Energy” was officially launched at POWER-GEN International. Coordinated by representatives from industry, higher education, economic development and government organizations, I Love NY Energy promotes the establishment of energy-related companies in New York State.

Wright Tool Co. introduced WrightGrip, a high-strength, antislip version of the company’s open-end wrenches, in sizes up to 1-1/4 inch. WrightGrip ensures that the wrench fits more snugly on the fastener, preventing the jaws from spreading and keeping the wrench from slipping.

Marley Cooling Technologies announced that its customer productivity program has delivered $5 million in annual productivity returns to customers in the power industry. Documented results from the Michigan South Central Power Agency and Mirant’s Chalk Point facility prove that cooling towers can be a revenue generating asset.

Terex showcased its T45 and T25G mobile generator sets. The units offer prime power capabilities of 36 kW and 20 kW, respectively, and can deliver both single and three-phase outputs.

Victaulic launched the Vic-Knife Series 793 and Series 797 Knife Gate Valves, ideal for slurry and abrasive services. Both valves employ a straightforward design and single set of bolts, offering contractors ease of installation and allowing for quick disassembly and assembly for seat and end replacement, which eliminates the cost of replacing the valve when new seats are necessary.

The new 150 kW model GGLB spark-ignited natural gas engine generator set from Cummins Power Generation is designed to provide full-rated standby power for backup and emergency power applications. A heavy-duty, four-cycle engine is torque-matched to a high-capacity AC alternator for handling motor starting loads.

Thomassen Turbine Systems, a wholly owned subsidiary of Calpine Corp., has received an order from the Israel Electric Corp. Ltd. to convert and modify four Frame 9E gas turbines from fuel oil-firing to dual-fuel firing.

Accumetrics Associates introduced a new digital rotor telemetry system, the Earth Fault Resistance Monitor, which continuously monitors insulation fault resistance in generators and motors to prevent catastrophic failure.

Governor Control Systems’ newest turbine control package, the Integrated Turbine Control family, delivers custom modular design and programming with HMI display of turbine graphics and data trending. Steam turbine users benefit from an independent, integrated control and safety system.

3D Instruments LLC released the Accu-Switch Switch Gauge, which offers a new standard for a mechanical pressure gauge with high/low switch contacts. The gold-plated switch contacts can be wired directly to electrical circuits to provide for operational alarms or can be used to stop/start pumps, valves, motors, etc.

Burgmann Industries GmbH & Co. KG introduced the new 6850V cover seal, which is self-sealing and has proven success in the high-pressure valves used at power plants. Burgmann also introduced an extension of its MDS diagnostic system that enables the continuous monitoring of mechanical seals via the internet.

Renold Hi-Tec Couplings launched its compact DCB-GS rubber-in-compression coupling, specifically designed for diesel drive applications.
